title: Senior UX Designer till globalt techbolag!
description:
Är du en erfaren UX-designer som brinner för att skapa affärsdrivna digitala upplevelser? Till en av våra kunder i teknikbranschen söker vi nu en **Senior UX Designer** som vill ta en strategisk roll i ett engagerat designteam med stort inflytande på användarupplevelse och affärsutveckling.

### **Om rollen**


I den här rollen får du chansen att arbeta med både externa och interna digitala lösningar – allt från kommersiella webbplatser till interna plattformar och partnerverktyg. Fokus ligger på **att förbättra kundresor, driva engagemang och skapa lösningar som bidrar till affärsnytta**.


Du arbetar nära både utvecklingsteam, andra UX-designers och affärsstakeholders – i en miljö där samarbete och användarcentrering står i centrum.

### **Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**

* Ta fram och implementera UX-strategier kopplade till affärsmål

* Genomföra research och analyser av användarbeteenden

* Skapa kundresor och service blueprints för att identifiera förbättringsområden

* Designa användarvänliga gränssnitt för webblösningar

* Leda workshops och co-creation-sessioner med olika intressenter

* Coacha andra UX-designers i teamet och sprida din kompetens i organisationen


### **Vi söker dig som har:**

* 5+ års erfarenhet inom UX eller produktdesign

* Erfarenhet av att driva designprocesser från research till färdig lösning

* Van att arbeta strategiskt med UX kopplat till affärsmål

* Kompetens inom service design och customer journey mapping


-Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga

* Tidigare erfarenhet av större organisationer och gärna B2B

* *Meriterande:* Erfarenhet av agila team, responsiva webbapplikationer, marknadsföring och digitala plattformar

**Ansök direkt eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (Angular + Python)
description:
**What does our application process look like? Learn more via** **this video**  

**Where do we hire from? Find out more about** **hiring at TestGorilla**

  

Hi there, I'm **Erica, Senior Engineering Manager** at TestGorilla. We’re excited to share more about the **Senior Full Stack Engineer** role and our team.

### **About TestGorilla**


Imagine a world where everyone lands their dream job. TestGorilla is revolutionizing the hiring process through skills-based hiring, empowering one billion people to do just that. Our platform provides scientifically validated tests, enabling companies to hire faster and without bias, based on true skills and potential. We also empower candidates to showcase their abilities and find ideal roles.


At TestGorilla, we stand for diversity, act with integrity, and put talent first. We celebrate individuality and creativity and believe in a workplace where you can make a big impact. Our team works in a flexible, autonomous environment with a focus on well-being and results.


Join us in creating a future where skills matter most, and everyone has the chance to land their dream job.

### **About the role**


As our **Senior Full Stack Engineer**, you'll be essential in achieving TestGorilla's vision of helping one billion people land their dream job. You'll lead the design and development of scalable, user-friendly features that empower candidates and hiring teams alike. This isn't just a role; it's your chance to make a real difference by shaping a product that levels the playing field for talent around the world. You’ll directly contribute to delivering a reliable, high-quality platform that helps companies make fair, skills-based hiring decisions at scale. Join our driven, remote-first team, and let’s achieve these ambitious goals together.

*Want to see what it's like to join the Engineering team and make an impact as a* **Senior Full Stack Engineer***? Get an inside look in this quick video:*

### **Responsibilities**


In this role, your responsibilities will include but not limited to:

* **Own features end-to-end across the stack -** from building robust backend services to crafting delightful user experiences
* Design and implement highly scalable and reliable architectures using modern technologies (e.g., Python, Django, Angular, AWS)
* **Lead the full software development lifecycle -** from ideation to deployment and everything in between
* Write clean, well-tested, maintainable code across backend and frontend systems
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to build intuitive and impactful user experiences
* Optimize both backend and frontend performance for speed, scalability, and reliability
* Mentor and support less-experienced engineers through technical guidance and leadership
* Contribute to and improve DevOps pipelines, ensuring efficient and secure deployments
* Foster a culture of technical excellence, continuous improvement, and knowledge sharing across disciplines

### **What you’ll bring**

* Uphold TestGorilla's behaviors and foster an inclusive, supportive culture.
* Collaborate effectively with global colleagues across teams and time zones.
* You have strong full stack experience delivering production-ready applications with modern backend and frontend technologies
* You aim for excellence—pixel-perfect UI, high-quality code, and lightning-fast load times
* You have experience designing, implementing, running, and maintaining scalable backend services, including REST APIs and event-driven architectures
* You ensure code quality by writing unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
* You participate in code reviews, contribute to architecture discussions, and mentor other team members through knowledge sharing and guidance
* You’re fluent with relational and NoSQL databases and understand cloud infrastructure, monitoring, and deployment practices
* You have a solid understanding of UX/UI design, usability, and accessibility
* You highly value building a world-class engineering team and helping others grow
* You’re motivated by about continuously improving your skills and learning new technologies
* You enjoy influencing others and promote technical excellence while staying open to change
* You’re resilient in ambiguous situations and approach challenges from multiple perspectives
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills—you validate your decisions and explain them clearly

***We typically expect candidates with 5+ years of engineering experience, and at least 3–5 years of Angular and Python experience, to have the skills above***



We actively seek diversity and encourage applications from everyone. If you're interested in this role but your experience doesn't perfectly match the description, please still apply. Studies show that women and underrepresented groups can be hesitant to apply unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and you're confident you can do the job, we encourage you to apply!

### **Bonus skills**

* You’ve worked in a SaaS product-based company
* You are experienced with Agile methodologies such as Scrum, or Kanban
* You have hands-on experience with DevOps, containerization, CI/CD (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions)
* You have experience with Django or similar web frameworks

### 

### **What’s in it for you?**

**Please note:** Some specifics, particularly around leave, may vary depending on your country of residence. This will be discussed during the hiring process.

* **Global Team:** Join a fully remote, mission-driven team from around the world
* **Competitive compensation:** Receive a competitive pay € 50,000 - € 80,000 + Share Appreciation Rights (SARs)
* **Remote & flexible work:** Work from almost anywhere. Enjoy flexible hours and asynchronous work to balance work and life.
  

*Check out the Countries we currently hire from* *here*
* **Remote work budget:** €1,000 per year to help you set up your home office
* **Growth & development:** Invest in yourself and your career with a 3.5% L&D budget and clear growth opportunities
* **Stimulating work environment:** Tackle new challenges and work with innovative technology in a dynamic setting
* **Connect with your team:** Join optional fun virtual socials, AMAs with team members and leadership, and regular fun chats. Build a strong sense of community!
* **TestGorilla community groups:** Join peers to build community and boost opportunities for connection, advocacy, and professional development.
* **Parent/Caregiver support:** We provide a caregiver-friendly work environment with paid 8-16 week parental leave and tailored return-to-work approaches
* **Work-life balance:** Our unlimited and flexible time off policy empowers you to take the time you need to recharge and maintain your well-being

### **Interested?**


We believe in using our own product to ensure fair and objective hiring. If this role aligns with your skills and aspirations, we invite you to complete one of our very own assessments. This will give you a firsthand experience of our platform and help us get to know you better. We look forward to hearing from you!


TestGorilla is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diverse teams are stronger teams, and we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We understand that some candidates may experience test anxiety, and we want to assure you that accommodations are available and can be requested prior to sitting our assessments. Your request will not negatively impact your application, as we do not factor this into our review process.

title: UX Domain Lead
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

  

Are you a seasoned design leader with a passion for driving strategic growth and impact within the Manufacturing, Purchasing, and Logistics sectors of a complex digital business environment?

**Who are you? And how can you make an impact?**
------------------------------------------------


You are an exceptionally experienced design leader, dedicated to integrating human-centered perspectives into digital product and service visions and strategies. With a strong emphasis on an end-to-end journey mindset, you are committed to ensuring that UX is a consistent and integral part of the development process throughout the digital product and service lifecycle. Your mission is to elevate UX maturity across the organization, enhancing understanding of UX principles and effectively employing UX resources and methods to achieve business objectives. You possess deep expertise in design methods and best practices across multiple disciplines, including Service Design, UX Research, and UX Design. As a dedicated specialist, you inspire and drive positive change by identifying and prioritizing roadblocks and untapped opportunities for increased efficiency, effectiveness, collaboration, and alignment across diverse teams and individuals. You thrive on connecting with people, listening to understand their needs, and continuously iterating on solutions. You are adept at navigating a complex stakeholder landscape and excel within a multifunctional leadership team, contributing beyond your immediate area of responsibility. You take pride in ensuring that UX is a core component of the development process by:

  

* Actively working to integrate UX design within operations.
* Aligning UX efforts across delivery areas to enhance the end-to-end journey perspective.
* Ensuring that UX designers effectively meet the needs of delivery areas and strategic initiatives, identifying team challenges, supporting both individual and team coaching, and ensuring the right mix of competencies to drive innovation, feature upgrades, and maintenance within a product context.
* Evangelizing good UX practices, believing in the democratization of design, and scaling UX beyond traditional boundaries.
**This is us, your new colleagues**
-----------------------------------

The User Experience Design Chapter in Digital Delivery collaborates with various parts of the organization to foster an environment where ideas, thoughts, and opinions can be shared. We are team players with common ambitions, and we succeed together by uncovering user needs through data and insights to enhance the usability of products and services across the enterprise. Our UX Design Chapter is dedicated to securing a coherent and cohesive user experience, interaction, and visual treatment across products and services, ensuring a holistic experience that is findable, credible, accessible, useful, usable, and desirable.

**Ready to shape tomorrow’s society together with us?**
-------------------------------------------------------


Are you passionate about making an impact through design? Do you thrive in orchestrating and facilitating business, people, and processes to amplify the value of design at scale? Are you eager to share your extensive experiences and cultivate an environment where ideas and opinions can flourish? With us, all of this is possible!

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Project Manager
description:
**WANTED: Contract Project Manager ready to drive change... lead... grow with us... challenge themselves... make an impact!**

  


**Why Join IDX?**


**Not Just Any Brands**: See your work come to life for iconic brands like Thule Group, Viaplay and Dustin.


**Collaborative Spirit**: Work alongside passionate innovators who share your thirst for progress.


**Continuous Learning:** Grow your skills with ongoing training, mentorship, and the freedom to experiment.


**Fast Paced & Fun**: Thrive in a dynamic environment where big ideas and bold action collide.


**Cutting-Edge Technolog**y: Play with the latest analytics tools, use AR to build immersive digital events, and explore the future of brand storytelling!


**Global Presence:** We Get It Done morning, day and night with offices across multiple time-zones!


**Our Perks**:



️ 25 days of paid vacation plus paid leave on your birthday every year



 Hybrid working (3 days in office)



 Dog friendly office



 Occupational health care insurance via Euro Accident



️‍ ️ Friskvårdsbidrag up to 5000 kr per year


* ️ Mental Health support including company EAP and resources



 Pension via Avanza Bank mirroring ITP



️ 4 paid volunteer days



 Regular social activities to promote team collaboration and community networking

  


**The Role**



We're looking for a Project Manager to join our Delivery team, based in Gothenburg from **September 2025-May 2026.** You will be responsible for the successful delivery of a variety of exciting digital projects for our Nordics and international client base of both listed and smaller organisations.



Following established processes to lead both client and project teams through the full project lifecycle, you will diligently control the scope, budget and quality of your projects, while clearly articulating status, successes, risks and issues to stakeholder and project teams.



Working in close collaboration with a talented team of Developers, creative designers and digital Marketers as well as the wider team based in other geographical areas.


**What You'll Be Doing**


* Chair internal project meetings including kick-offs, retrospectives and status as well as contributing to external client project meetings chaired by an Account Manager
* Lead clients to ensure effective expectation management and alignment, ensuring team and client have clarity on scope, schedule and change process
* Provide clear and regular communication to ensure continual team alignment on delivery status, milestones, risks and issues
* Partner effectively and ensure transition to offshore build Project Manager
* Produce scope, estimates and budget for a variety of small to med digital projects
* Produce and maintain project plan and resource forecast
* Maintain project margin throughout project lifecycle
* Govern project team adherence to delivery process and associated meetings whilst motivating and mentoring project team toward successful outcomes
* Ensure close collaboration with PMO function with regard to resource forecasting
* Advise on process improvements and refinement where applicable

  

**About You**


* Relevant experience as a digital project manager in a client facing environment
* Previous experience in a digital marketing agency or equivalent
* Swedish and English speaking
* Competence in SEO, CRO, UX, digital analysis or similar (ideal).
* Ability to manage/lead or provide governance for multiple projects
* Strong leadership skills
* Strong numerical, written and oral presentation skills
* Strong negotiation and facilitation skills
* Strong client and stakeholder management skills
* Defining scope, budget and quality assurance skills
* Highly process orientated and attention to detail
* Ability to select or adapt delivery methodology for project type
* Excellent working knowledge of project management tools
* Consistency in approach, best practices and team management
* Ability to lead pitch for medium-large sized projects alongside a sales owner

  


**About Us**



IDX isn't your average communications company. With over 20 years industry experience and a portfolio of prominent global clients, our award-winning communication solutions are seen by billions every month across a global audience.



We seek The Bold. Shatter expectations, push boundaries – that's the fuel that ignites our powerhouse team. Collaboration is our superpower, where we bring expertise and individuality to elevate and deliver. Rising Stars with boundless hunger, this is your launchpad. Seasoned pros who want to define their Legacy in the industry, this is your home. **Be BOLD – Own Your Story at IDX.**

  


**An Inclusive Workplace**



IDX is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We aim to foster an environment that desires and recruits diverse talent, cultivates a culture that celebrates all identities, life experiences, perspectives, and ensures equal opportunity for all.

  


**Are you a creative problem-solver who craves a challenge? Do you get fired up by innovation and pushing boundaries? Join the IDX revolution!**
company_description: Investis Digital is a digital communications and marketing company trusted by c1600 global clients.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer within the Defense Industry (CAD/CREO)
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Are you always looking ahead and pushing the boundaries of what’s technically possible?**
  

Are you curious, innovative, and eager to continue growing within product development? Then you might be the one we’re looking for! We are currently seeing a growing demand for mechanical designers for assignments within the defense industry and are seeking someone with experience in mechanical design using **PTC Creo**.



As a mechanical designer, you will work at the cutting edge of technology in an agile, cross-functional team. The assignment involves the development of advanced sensor systems with high demands on quality, safety, and innovation. You will be responsible for designing and developing mechanical solutions, often in close collaboration with colleagues from related technical areas, as well as with manufacturing and suppliers.



You will be an important part of a team working with:


* Design of components in mechanics and power distribution
* CAD modeling and documentation using **Creo**, and work in systems such as **Windchill** and **IFS**
* Concept studies, improvement work, and technical dialogue with suppliers

**PERSONALITY AND COMPETENCE**



We are looking for someone who enjoys working in project-based environments—both in teams and independently—and who communicates clearly, confidently, and effectively. You are driven, engaged, and always strive to deliver your best. You are attentive to the customer’s/project’s needs and can quickly adapt to new environments and cultures. At your core, you have a passion for technology and solid skills in **Creo**.



**EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS**



* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Product Development, or similar
* A few years of experience in mechanical design, preferably within the defense, automotive, or manufacturing industries
* Proficiency in **PTC Creo** and a natural interest in technology
* Fluent in both **Swedish and English**, written and spoken
* Experience in product-oriented development in **agile teams** is highly meritorious

**WHO ARE WE?**



We offer much more than just an assignment—we offer a workplace where people are at the heart of everything. At Sigma Industry West, openness, participation, and energy are the foundation of our culture. We combine **stability with an entrepreneurial spirit**, where each employee is given the opportunity to grow—both technically and personally.



We like to have fun together—whether it's after-works, events, workout activities, or inspirational talks. Professional development has always been important to us. In addition to opportunities for development in your consulting assignments and technical training, we have internal programs for personal growth. "Flow by Sigma" is a program focusing on work-life balance, setting and achieving personal goals, and managing change. We also have a mentorship program that starts every year with several mentors and mentees. We offer LinkedIn Learning licenses for those interested in self-paced digital studies.



At **Sigma Industry West**, our employees are our most valuable asset.



We provide top-tier expertise in areas such as product development, UX, industrial IT, embedded systems, production engineering, and project management. We offer both on-site consulting and project deliveries from our local offices—covering everything from the first product sketch all the way to manufacturing.





Since our founding in 2014, we’ve experienced fantastic growth. Together with our sister companies **Sigma Embedded Engineering** and **Sigma Energy & Marine**, we are now over **300 employees**, with operations in **Sweden, the USA, and Norway**.



**Sigma Group**



As part of the **Sigma Group**, we offer the best of both worlds: stability and a true entrepreneurial spirit. Sigma consists of several companies across various technical disciplines, with over **3,500 employees** in **11 countries**, making us **Sweden’s largest privately owned consulting group**.





We work with ongoing selection – so apply today!  

If you have any questions or want to learn more, don’t hesitate to contact us. We look forward to hearing from you.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Kim Stockman,  

+46 702118092  

kim.stockman@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Mechanical Design Engineer within the Defense Industry (CAD/CREO)
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry West
* #### **LOCATION**


Göteborg, Sweden
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-05-16
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-07-01
* #### **CONTACT**


Kim Stockman, kim.stockman@sigma.se, +46702118092

Upper Saddle River, NJ 07458

title: UX Manager
description:
**Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights, TUI, etc.**

**Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 2600 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Canada, Greece, India, Uruguay and Poland.**

 **About the role**  

As a User Experience Manager at Etraveli Group, you will lead a team of UX designers that are responsible for the experience in our digital channels. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including product owners, QA, developers, and stakeholders to make sure that we provide a seamless and intuitive user experience that drives engagement, satisfaction, and meets our business goals.

  

We are looking for a UX Manager to join and lead one of our UX teams. This team is focused on enhancing the experiences of our customer service agents, with the goal of enabling them to provide the best possible service to our travellers.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Strategy**

* Define and execute on the overall UX strategy aligned with business and tech.
* Lead and conduct research to understand user needs, behaviours, and pain points and translate insights into actions.
* Ensure that UX initiatives contribute to key business metrics.

**Management**

* Manage a team of UX designers, providing guidance, mentorship and support.
* Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture focused on continuous improvement.
* Manage resources effectively to meet project timelines and deliverables.

**Design**

* Manage and lead the UX process from start to end.
* Create wireframes, prototypes, and design specifications to communicate design concepts effectively.
* Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to iterate and improve designs

**Collaboration**

* Collaborate with product owners, developers, and other stakeholders to align UX efforts with business goals and technical feasibility.
* Facilitate workshops and cross-functional meetings to gather insights and drive alignment.

**Requirements**

* Relevant education in the field, with several years of proven experience within UX and experience working in a manager role.
* Expertise in all stages of the UX process, including research, problem identification, ideation, prototyping, and validation.
* Proven track record of successfully aligning UX initiatives with business goals and driving measurable results.
* Strong leadership, mentoring and communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across teams while you have a passion for developing and empowering team members.
* Proficiency with Figma, as well as experience with design systems.
* Solid understanding of web and mobile technologies
* A portfolio showcasing successful UX projects and design solutions.

**Benefits**


Working at Etraveli Group means working at a fast-growing company with high ambitions in becoming the number one Online travel agency worldwide. The culture at the company embraces complexity and we like to keep the entrepreneurial spirit even as we grow into being a larger company. You will have awesome colleagues with whom you will have fun solving complex problems in a fast-moving business.

  

We also offer:

* A flexible working environment. We work on a hybrid-model where you can choose to work two days from home and you will have two weeks per year that you can choose to work from a remote location.
* Breakfast every morning.
* Central office location in Gothenburg, Skeppsbron 5.
* Healthcare allowance – Each employee receives a maximum allowable amount each year according to the Swedish Tax Agency to spend on health-promoting activities such as a gym card, massage etc.
* Pension and private health insurance – Through partners we offer a comprehensive pension and private health insurance.  

  

**As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.**
  

  

At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds. During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.Welcome to Etraveli Group!  

  

#LI-MH1
company_description: Etraveli Group is a global platform for flights, an air technology company with a presence across all continents.

title: CTO för AI-scaleup
description:
As part of responsibilities
  
Own the end-to-end technical strategy and architecture of our SaaS platform.
  
Design and implement scalable NLP and computer vision systems which of many based on transformers and multimodal pipelines.
  
Optimize performance, security, and cost at every layer, from GPU inference to frontend latency
  
Own major SaaS infrastructure decisions (Kubernetes, CI/CD, monitoring, APIs).
  
Evaluate and integrate new LLMs, smart aggregation pipelines and agentic AI solutions into production.
  
Manage and lead of remote team of highly experienced data scientists and software developers
  
  

As part of expectations
  
Proven experience as a senior technical leader in fast-paced startups, ideally SaaS
  
Deep hands-on experience with Python, JS/TS, Apache Spark, React, and modern ML stacks (HuggingFace, PyTorch, etc.).
  
Experience leading teams building large scale analytics and visualization tools
  
A strategic mindset, but with the instinct to jump into code when needed
  
Track record of shipping products used by enterprise clients
  
Experience working with B2B UX challenges
  
Interest in or experience with text-heavy industries (intelligence, consulting, healthcare)

title: Senior UX Designer till globalt techbolag!
description:
Är du en erfaren UX-designer som brinner för att skapa affärsdrivna digitala upplevelser? Till en av våra kunder i teknikbranschen söker vi nu en Senior UX Designer som vill ta en strategisk roll i ett engagerat designteam med stort inflytande på användarupplevelse och affärsutveckling.
  
Om rollen
  
I den här rollen får du chansen att arbeta med både externa och interna digitala lösningar – allt från kommersiella webbplatser till interna plattformar och partnerverktyg. Fokus ligger på att förbättra kundresor, driva engagemang och skapa lösningar som bidrar till affärsnytta.
  
Du arbetar nära både utvecklingsteam, andra UX-designers och affärsstakeholders – i en miljö där samarbete och användarcentrering står i centrum.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

* Ta fram och implementera UX-strategier kopplade till affärsmål
* Genomföra research och analyser av användarbeteenden
* Skapa kundresor och service blueprints för att identifiera förbättringsområden
* Designa användarvänliga gränssnitt för webblösningar
* Leda workshops och co-creation-sessioner med olika intressenter
* Coacha andra UX-designers i teamet och sprida din kompetens i organisationen


**Vi söker dig som har:**  

* 5+ års erfarenhet inom UX eller produktdesign
* Erfarenhet av att driva designprocesser från research till färdig lösning
* Van att arbeta strategiskt med UX kopplat till affärsmål
* Kompetens inom service design och customer journey mapping
* Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga
* Tidigare erfarenhet av större organisationer och gärna B2B
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av agila team, responsiva webbapplikationer, marknadsföring och digitala plattformar


Ansök direkt eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
  
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story.
  
About the role
  
Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions
  
Design client-side and server-side architecture
  
Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design
  
Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
  
Write effective APIs
  
Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
  
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software
  
Create security and data protection settings
  
Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design
  
Write technical documentation
  
Work with data scientists and analysts to improve software
  
  

To succeed in the role
  
Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role
  
Experience developing desktop and mobile applications
  
Familiarity with common stacks
  
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
  
Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
  
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design
  
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
  
Great attention to detail
  
Organizational skills
  
  

About us
  
Cognizant is a global leader within Information Technology Services (Fortune 500 since 2011). The company was founded in 1994, and the Head Quarters is still in USA. Cognizant, which was originally Dun & Bradstreets own inhouse bureau, serves the market with vertical solutions for digital automation (cloud, AI, IoT and analytics). Cognizant operates in industries like Health Care, Life Science, Banking and Finance, Insurance, Retail, Production, Logistics, Energy etc and is a key player within the Digital revolution. Cognizant Global has a revenue of USD 17 billion and nearly 300 000 employees.
  
The Cognizant community
  
We are a high caliber team who appreciate and support one another. Our people uphold an energetic, collaborative and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive.
  
Cognizant is a global community with more than 300,000+ associates around the world.
  
We don’t just dream of a better way – we make it happen.
  
We take care of our people, clients, company, communities and climate by doing what’s right.
  
We foster an innovative environment where you can build the career path that’s right for you.

title: Managing Design Lead
description:
Are you a creative and dedicated tech industry professional with experience in game design? Are you a humble and learning focused leader who wants to coach people through their career? Are you interested in Paradox Development Studio and our brands and eager to help us take them to the next level? Then you may be the one we’re looking for!
  
As a Design Manager on the Hearts of Iron team at our development studio in Stockholm, you will be manager of our Designers with the overall responsibility for enabling the team to thrive and deliver on their tasks.
  
As Design Manager you will also work directly with the game, and you will have a direct and influential impact on the quality and feel of the game.
  
We are seeking people who are able to take on a lead role in a multi domain discipline. The Design team on Hearts of Iron includes UX Design, Content Design and Game Design. As their manager, being able to navigate these elements is an important part of the job.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Assume personnel responsibilities and directly manage the Designers on the team.
  
  

Be able to organize and coordinate the design process for a feature or system, set clear goals and expectations for a design task, and occasionally act as the Coordinator of a feature team
  
  

Coordinate between feature teams on a project level and make sure feature teams have feature owners.
  
  

Fostering an open and trusting environment
  
  

Assure staffing needs are met on our projects
  
  

Performance evaluations & feedback
  
  

Hands on work with Design and implementation
  
  

Required qualifications
  
Manager experience within a team or department
  
  

Passion for leadership, mentoring and coaching, as well as organizational development
  
  

Experience working in a role that requires a mix of a mind for strategy as well as excellent communication and collaboration skills
  
  

Experience within Narrative, Content, Level Design or Game Design
  
  

Scripting experience
  
  

Fluent in English, both written and spoken
  
  

As a person, we think you are the type who enjoys seeing the people around you improve and who gains satisfaction from helping others overcome their obstacles. You know how to apply your own experience and learnings from working as a designer. As a manager you are attentive and humble and are able to coach your team members to develop on a professional level. You understand the importance of building trust and you know how to be open and approachable. You are not afraid of conflicts and you are able to navigate them in a constructive manner.
  
  

You are comfortable in decision making and can easily anticipate the impact and consequences it will have. You also have experience working in a large organization, and understand the organizational challenges and processes associated with company growth.
  
  

Practical information
  
**Scope:** Full time and permanent
  
**Reports to:** Operations manager
  
**Location:** This position is based in Stockholm.
  
If you think that this description matches your background, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously for this position. In your application, please show us why your previous experiences and skills would work for this role and why you are interested in working at Paradox. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in Paradox might compensate for this.

title: Shopify Store Quality Analyst
description:
**We’re on the lookout for a Shopify Store Quality Analyst** **to join our expanding team and drive our company’s growth!**

 **The Challenge**


As we open more stores, we need someone who can help us uphold a high standard of quality across all our online stores. You’ll play a critical role in ensuring that every customer-facing detail meets our standards before going live. If you're someone who has a sharp eye for details and can put yourself in the shoes of a customer, we want to hear from you.

 **Ready to make an impact? Here’s what we’re looking for…**

  

* You have at least **4+ years** of experience in **Quality Assurance**
* You have hands-on experience with **e-commerce webshops,** specifically with **Shopify stores**
* You have a strong eye for user experience and functionality
* You are familiar with using Google Sheets or similar tools for tracking QA activity
* Prior experience in a similar role is essential

*No coding required for this role.*

 **Your main responsibilities will include..**

* Run quality checks on all our stores

A. Test core functionality and make sure everything works as it should
B. Review the user experience (UX) and identify areas that feel confusing, slow, or broken


C. Check newly imported products regularly for errors or inconsistencies

  

* Send the team your comments and make sure everyone knows what needs fixing
* Log your QA findings and activity clearly in internal sheets
* Report your work and insights to your manager

 **What Success Looks Like in This Role..**

* Regularly catch issues before customers do
* Flag areas for improvement that lead to better conversions or fewer complaints
* Reports are consistent, clear, and actionable

 **Your Team When You Join Us**


You’ll be part of a vibrant Growth Expansion Team, working hand-in-hand with our dynamic Growth Expansion Manager. Work alongside amazing and talented team members from France, Germany, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Pakistan, and the Philippines, all working remotely but closely together to elevate and boost our Bulk stores. Get ready to collaborate with a group that's as enthusiastic about success as you are!

 **Overview of Our Interview Process**

**Application Submission** - We’ll start by reviewing your application.



* **Test Gorilla Assessment** - You will be invited to take a 19-minute written examination to help us assess your fitness for the role and our team. Please note that passing this stage is crucial to move forward in the hiring process.


* **Initial Contact** - Our Recruiter will reach out to you to discuss the next steps

	+ HR Initial Interview
* **Final Interview**

	+ Meet with the Hiring Manager.
* **Offer Discussion** - If all goes well, we'll discuss the offer and invite you to our pre-onboarding process.


* **Pre-Onboarding Process**

	+ **Background Check:** Verification of your identification and declared address.

	+ **Reference Check:** We’ll contact your three references for their feedback.
* **Onboarding:** Once all checks are completed, we’ll initiate the onboarding process.


**The Company in a Nutshell**


GTEcom BV (https://gtecombv.com/) was established in 2018 and headquartered in The Netherlands. Our mission is to continue scaling our operations and opening & sustaining more successful global brands to achieve our target of $500M revenue and more than 50 stores worldwide by 2026. Our diverse team of 180 and growing remote e-commerce experts in their own niches from different parts of the world is helping us transform our vision of growing the company to a reality.


We are committed to cultivating a culture of hard work, freedom and responsibility, constant improvement, and positivity in our team.

 **The Upsides of Working with Us**

* Thrive in a results-driven environment with the autonomy to shape your own approach
* Achieve a great work-life balance with remote work and flexible schedule
* Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and contributions
* Collaborate with a dynamic remote team
* Be a key player in our rapidly growing company

title: Projektledare Digitalisering
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning – Projektledare för digitalisering inom offentlig verksamhet**


En driven projektledare med teknisk förståelse sökes för att leda digitaliseringsinitiativ inom offentlig sektor. Personen som efterfrågas har troligtvis erfarenhet från IT-området, exempelvis genom att ha lett DevOps-team eller arbetat med automatiseringsinitiativ.


I uppdraget ingår att driva verksamhetsutveckling i nära samverkan med både tekniska resurser och verksamhetsrepresentanter. Det är viktigt att ha en god balans mellan förståelse för teknik och förmågan att skapa trygghet och framdrift i förändringsarbete. Målet är att öka nyttjandet av digital infrastruktur som stöd i verksamhetens processer.


Uppdraget kräver en person med stark kommunikativ förmåga som kan motivera och skapa samsyn mellan olika parter – allt från IT-avdelning och verksamhet till externa leverantörer. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att omvandla verksamhetens behov till tekniska krav vid till exempel upphandlingar eller vidareutveckling av befintliga lösningar. Du ingår i ett större team med kompetenser inom bland annat API-utveckling, dataanalys, UX/UI och innovationsledning.

**Obligatoriska krav:**

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av projektledning inom IT-området
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att leda digitaliseringsprojekt inom kommunal verksamhet under de senaste 5 åren
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda projekt inom automatisering, API-utveckling och/eller systemintegration
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Kunna uppge två referenser som är kontaktbara för uppdragsutvärdering
* Tillgänglig för arbete på plats minst 50 % av uppdragstiden per vecka
* Möjlighet att med kort varsel närvara fysiskt på arbetsplatsen vid behov

**Meriterande:**

* Väl dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbetssätt och projekt kopplade till den typ av digitalisering som beskrivs i uppdraget

**Uppdragsomfattning:**  

Start: 30 juni 2025  

Slut: 30 juni 2026  

Inledningsvis omfattning på minst 50 %, med planerad utökning till cirka 100 % senast 10 augusti 2025

**Placering:**  

På plats i Sundsvall, enligt krav om fysisk närvaro

 **Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Product Designer
description:
**Design the Future of Delivery Experiences**


At Ingrid, we design the platform layer that connects consumers, retailers, carriers, and partners to create seamless delivery experiences. From how merchants configure delivery options to how customers choose and track them, our tools sit at the center of a highly dynamic and distributed ecosystem.


As a product designer here, you’ll work on challenges that live at the intersection of logistics, commerce, and human behavior—translating complex systems into intuitive, efficient, and scalable product experiences.


We’re looking for someone who brings both strong craft and high output. Someone who doesn’t just experiment with AI tools, but relies on them to expand creative range, iterate faster, and scale design work across surfaces and states.


You’ll join a lean and collaborative product team—working closely with PMs, engineers, and two other designers—to shape the end-to-end product experience.

**What You’ll Do**

* Design intuitive product experiences across web and API surfaces—from configuration to customer-facing touchpoints
* Own problems end-to-end: from framing and exploration to prototyping, testing, and final UI
* Use AI-enhanced tools as a core part of your design workflow
* Contribute to and evolve our growing design system in Figma
* Collaborate tightly with engineers and PMs to ship with high velocity
* Help shape Ingrid’s design culture, rituals, and quality bar

**What We’re Looking For**

* 4–8+ years of experience designing digital products, ideally in SaaS or systems-heavy environments
* A portfolio that shows UX depth, systems thinking, and polished visual execution
* Demonstrated experience using AI tools in your workflow as a default—not a novelty
* A self-directed, pragmatic approach with sound judgment around depth vs. speed
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across disciplines
* **Bonus:** experience with design systems, developer-facing products, or configuration-heavy UIs

**Why Ingrid?**


Ingrid powers the delivery experience layer for leading e-commerce brands like **NA-KD**, **Apoteket**, and **Paul Smith**. Our platform orchestrates the connection between retailers, carriers, consumers, and partners—enabling fast, flexible, and reliable delivery choices across Europe.


You’ll join a product team that values autonomy, clarity, and craft. We prioritize learning fast, solving real problems, and designing systems that scale.

**Location & Ways of Working**


This role is based in Stockholm, with a hybrid setup. While day-to-day presence at the office is not required, we value in-person collaboration and encourage regular face time with the team at our HQ.

**How to Apply**


Send us your **portfolio** and a short note about how AI tools are part of your design workflow. We’re excited to meet designers who are building with the future in mind.

title: E-commerce Product Manager
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**


We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.


Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.


**THE ROLE**


We’re hiring an E-commerce Product Manager to lead our Engage & Explore team — the cross-functional squad responsible for everything from the moment a customer lands on our site to the moment they hit “Add to Cart.” This includes the start page, search, category listing, product page, navigation, and all content and functionality that supports product discovery, comparison, and decision-making.


You’ll have a clear mandate to define the strategy and own the roadmap for this critical part of the e-commerce journey. Your team includes product specialists, a tech focused product owner, developers, UX designers, and a senior web analyst and you’ll be the go-to contact for stakeholders across marketing, SEO, design, category teams, and leadership.


This is a role for someone who can balance strategy and execution, challenge assumptions, lead UX/UI direction, and build for scale, all while keeping a laser focus on what moves the needle for customers and the business.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Define and own the strategy and roadmap for the full pre-checkout buying experience, with autonomy to prioritize what matters most.
* Lead the UX/UI direction of our sites in close partnership with dedicated UX designers, leveraging our state-of-the-art design system to deliver a premium, consistent experience.
* Act as the main point of contact for internal stakeholders, aligning cross-functional needs into a focused and data-driven product vision.
* Set and track your team’s core KPIs - such as conversion, engagement, and content performance and continuously act on them.
* Drive a healthy mix of new development, UX improvements, and technical debt reduction, making smart tradeoffs based on long-term value.
* Build solutions that are scalable across all our sites, brands, and markets, ensuring both flexibility and performance.
* Champion the voice of the customer and the experience of the end user in every decision.
* Leverage data to understand user behavior, identify friction, and validate impact.
* Bring a strong e-commerce perspective to the table and challenge ideas to raise the bar for both product and business outcomes.

**WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU**

  

* 5–8+ years experience in e-commerce, as an Online Manager, Digital Experience Lead, Product Manager, or similar.
* Proven ability to define and drive a product strategy and roadmap, with measurable business results.
* Experience leading cross-functional product teams, ideally including designers, analysts, and developers.
* Strong grasp of UX/UI best practices, with experience working with a design system and design process.
* Skilled at weighing technical debt vs. new development, and driving decisions that support long-term scalability.
* Familiarity with technical ecosystems (e.g., APIs, CMS, page speed) and how they affect customer experience.
* Excellent stakeholder communication, with the ability to challenge ideas, aligning, and influencing across departments.
* Experience building for multi-market ecommerce, with sensitivity to localization, compliance, and market nuances.
* A data-driven mindset, with the ability to analyze product performance and act on insights.
* 

**WHAT WE OFFER**


We are a value driven company with our values *We team up*, *Innovation Drives Us*, *Inclusion & Non-Hierarchy* and *Going the Extra Mile* at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.


Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings

**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**


If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!


Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.


If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create marketing content and be a part of taking our product to market.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Experience with Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially
