title: Content & Social Media Manager - German Speaking
description:
**Who We Are**
 Anyfin is a fintech company on a mission to improve people’s financial lives. We simplify loan repayments by lowering loan costs and giving people more control over their financial future. And now, we’re looking for a native German-speaking Social media & Content Manager, to join our team in Stockholm, drive our presence in Germany and make sure our brand is impossible to ignore.
   

  

 You'll be the go-to person for all things content and organic social media in Germany, balancing creativity with data-driven execution - helping us stand out, stay relevant, and grow fast.
   

  

**What you will be doing**
* Take full ownership of Anyfin’s social media voice in Germany, making sure it’s sharp, engaging, and aligned with our brand strategy.
* Manage and grow our social media presence, creating high-performing content that resonates with our audience.
* Stay ahead of trends and consumer behavior, proactively bringing fresh ideas to the table.
* Create content for Social media (TikTok, Meta etc), but also web, emails, and ads.
* Work closely with designers, marketers, and product teams to ensure a seamless brand experience across all channels.


**Who You Are**
* A native German speaker with an exceptional fingerspitzengefühl for language and messaging.
* A social media enthusiast who understands what makes content perform across platforms – and loves the challenge of standing out.
* A creative doer who love strong ideas, as well as making them come to life.
* Ambitious, proactive, and not just looking for any job. You want to own your area and grow fast.


**What We Offer**
* The chance to define and lead Anyfin’s voice in Germany.
* A fast-moving, high-energy environment where you’ll be trusted with big responsibilities from day one.
* A supportive, ambitious, and ego-free culture where everyone works hard


 Ready to shape the future of financial health? Apply now and join us on this journey!
   

  

*This role is based out of our centrally located Stockholm office.*
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Head of Analytics, Sales Strategy - North
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Operations
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 Sales Strategy and Operations is a critical function within Salesforce to drive profitable growth at scale, partnering with our senior leaders as trusted advisors. Some of the main topics covered are setting strategic business priorities to drive profitable growth, building and implementing long term GTM strategies, setting best-in class operational processes, systems and tools, owning cross-functional entrepreneurial projects end to end and leading change management processes to transform and scale the business in a standard way across countries, segments and clouds.
   

  

 We are looking for a leader to act as a trusted business partner to Head of Sales Strategy North driving key North projects end to end. The role will encompass supporting the Head of Sales Strategy North and the North CEO and North COO on their day-to-day operations, which will include GTM design, sales cadence execution, cross-functional alignment and strategic projects. The selected candidate will be part of the North Sales Strategy leadership team and will manage and develop a SWAT team of highly talented strategy analysts to cover the aforementioned duties.
   

  

 This strategy leader will embrace the challenges of operating in a complex matrix environment, driving alignment and building relationships with cross-functional partners (strategy, marketing, sales programs, enablement, business technology, etc.), regional peers and HQ functional leaders.
   

  

**Scope**
* Become a trusted advisor to the Head of Sales Strategy North and leadership team
* Own sophisticated North cross-functional initiatives end to end, with limited supervision
* Lead and encourage a community of North analysts, closely partnering and aligning with regional office leaders
* Own the data & business intelligence strategy, driving AI innovation leveraging the Salesforce Platform
* Lead and develop an outstanding team, fully aligned and connected with other regional strategy teams, crafting an environment that attracts top talent and where everyone can contribute, succeed and grow


**Skills/Expertise Required**
* Strong previous experience in a business operations role within a high growth SaaS company operating at scale or equivalent experience within a management consulting firm
* Some people management experience in a high growth, constantly evolving environment
* Thoughtful leadership, track record of advising leadership and influencing partners
* Proven experience of rolling out GTM models along several planning cycles
* Strong project management track record, having successfully led cross-functional critical initiatives end to end
* Inspirational people leader, with a track record of attracting and developing top talent


**Additionally, The Ideal Candidate Will Possess The Following**
* A reputation for unquestionable ethics and integrity; sets the tone from the top and demonstrates the highest level of integrity, authenticity, and transparency
* High level of intellectual curiosity and self-awareness with low expressed ego
* Company-first mindset, demonstrating a continuous focus on what is business relevant and can respond quickly


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 We are a recognised Disability Confident member under the UK Government Disability Confident employer scheme. We are committed to providing an inclusive recruitment process and will offer an interview to disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria for the role. Applicants are welcome to opt-in to the interview scheme as part of the application process. If you would like to apply under the scheme, please click the link to the Accommodations Request Form above and scroll to the UK Disability Confident Scheme section within the form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Gruppchef inom sensorteknik
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du redo för en större uppgift?
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 Nationellt forensiskt centrum, NFC, är polisens operativa avdelning för forensisk labbverksamhet. På uppdrag av förundersökningsledare utför NFC forensiska undersökningar av spår och material från brottsutredningar. Avdelningen ansvarar också för myndighetens kvalitetssäkring av den forensiska verksamheten i stort, samt för att utveckla arbetssätt och metoder för verk-samheten. Till avdelningens uppdrag hör också forensisk forskning och utveckling, ett arbete som ofta bedrivs i internationell samverkan.
   

  

 Inom sektionen för bild- och ljudanalys har vi en samlad kompetens inom ämnesområdena bild-, video-, och ljudanalys, bild- och ljudrelaterad biometri, jämförande bild- och ljudundersökningar, sensorteknik, forensisk fotografering samt automatisk bildanalys och forensisk AI. Sektionen har i uppdrag att inom verksamhetsområdena genomföra forensiska undersökningar och analyser, fortlöpande bedriva metodutveckling, vidareutveckla den forensiska processen, bedriva undervisning samt vara ett expertstöd inom rättsväsendet. Vi är omkring 80 medarbetare och finns i både Linköping och Malmö.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en gruppchef till Sensorteknik 1 med placering i Linköping. Gruppen för Sensorteknik är främst inriktad på ny teknik för att på effektivare sätt avbilda och visualisera brottsplatser, spår och händelseförlopp. Området kan delas in i inhämtning/avbildning, visualisering och analys. Utvecklingen bedrivs i nära samarbete med landets forensiska sektioner, relevanta företag och forskningsinstitut.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som gruppchef rapporterar du till sektionschef samt ingår i sektionens ledningsgrupp, där ni tillsammans ansvarar för att uppdrag genomförs samt att driva myndighetens förändrings- och utvecklingsarbete. Du har särskilt ansvar för gruppens verksamhet och dess resultat. Som gruppchef företräder du hela Polismyndigheten både internt och externt samt arbetar för att stärka förtroendet för polisverksamheten.
   

  

 Att vara chef och ledare inom Polismyndigheten innebär att skapa trygghet och bygga förtroende genom att utöva ett uppriktigt, modigt och lyhört ledarskap med tillit till andras kompetens och förmåga. Som chef driver du utveckling genom att inspirera och uppmuntra till reflektion och återkoppling på ett sätt som utgår från att vi följer lagen och behandlar människor lika. Du skapar förutsättningar och verkar för goda relationer som bidrar till att vi agerar tillsammans utifrån vad som är bäst för medborgarna och uppdraget som helhet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* minst 12 månaders sammanhängande erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som chef, arbetsledare, eller liknande den senaste femårsperioden
* erfarenhet av att leda förändrings- och utvecklingsarbeten
* kandidatexamen med inriktning mot teknik eller annan inriktning eller utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant för tjänsten
* mycket goda kunskaper i svenska språket, både i tal och skrift
* relevant erfarenhet inom IT- och teknikområdet


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du utöver detta även har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att leda teknikintensiv verksamhet.
* erfarenhet av att leda andra mot uppsatta mål och resultat
* ingått i ledningsforum
* erfarenhet av leda verksamhet med fokus på forskning och utveckling
* erfarenhet av polisorganisationens verksamhet
* chefs- och ledarskapsutbildning för direkt, indirekt och/eller strategisk nivå


 När vi anställer kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och ledarskapsförmågor. Som grund för den bedömningen ligger Polismyndighetens ledarkriterier. Ledarkriterierna anger en beskrivning av ett önskvärt ledarskap inom Polismyndigheten och omfattar följande förmågor:
   

  

* Analys och helhetssyn
* Mål och resultat
* Utveckling och förändring
* Social säkerhet
* Muntlig och skriftlig kommunikation
* Skapa delaktighet och motivation


 Läs mer om ledarkriterierna polisen.se/ledarkriterier/ Om inte länken är klickbar kopiera och klistra in länktexten i din webbläsare.
   

  

 Som en del i urvalsprocessen kommer även tester att användas.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Klas Brorsson Läthén , Sektionschef
   

  

 klas.brorsson@polisen.se
   

  

 Carl Svensson
   

  

 carl-a.svensson@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet Sofia Ask, tfn 010-56 38710; ST region-ost@polisen.se SEKO Polisen Karna Tillheden, tfn 0732490422; SACO Fanny Carlström Plaza, tfn 010 562 8446
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

* Tillsvidareanställning med funktion som chef grupp
* Anställningen kan komma att inledas med en provanställning
* Placering i Linköping


 Enligt gällande lagstiftning kräver anställningen att blivande anställd lämnar ett DNA-prov för registrering i myndighetens elimineringsdatabas.
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 Vi använder e-rekrytering för att effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsarbetet. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Polisens rekryteringsstöd Visma Recruit.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 Om du vill komplettera din ansökan vänder du dig till ansvarig HR-konsult.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på: polisen.se/erbjudande
   

  

 Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen. Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 polisen.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Business Controller
description:
GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.
   

  

 Do you want to help shape the financial story behind tomorrow’s digital infrastructure? Are you motivated by building smart financial models and getting close to the business?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Business Controller to join our growing Business Finance NetCo team. This role is highly involved in capex controlling where you’ll support on large investment cases as well as being involved in a major IT Transformation Project.
   

  

 NetCo oversees one of the region's largest interconnected fiber networks, spanning over 235,000 kilometers and driving more than 50 % of all data traffic in the Nordics. With an annual CAPEX spend of approximately €160 million, these substantial investments reflect GlobalConnect’s strong commitment to consolidating its position as the leading fiber operator in Northern Europe.
   

  

 Help build the financial backbone in Group IT
   

  

 As a Business Controller, you’ll play a key role in making sure our financial planning and capital investments are solid, smart, and aligned with our long-term ambitions. You’ll focus on capex controlling for one of our main business units.
   

  

 You’ll create and refine financial models, participate in business boards, and ensure that our forecasts are accurate and meaningful. With cash flow and profitability in mind, you’ll help us prioritize the right investments and secure transparency across the board.
   

  

 Your closest colleagues will be a Nordic team of finance professionals who work hybrid across locations. You'll report to the Director, Business Controlling Netco who is based in Norway, and you will be part of a collaborative, cross-border environment where financial insights help guide real-world decisions.
   

  

 You can be based in Copenhagen, Stockholm, or Oslo — and we work in a hybrid setup where collaboration is key, but flexibility is real. Some travel within the Nordics may occur.
   

  

 Why join the GlobalConnect Finance team?
   

  

 This role gives you the chance to work close to the business, support big investment decisions, and help develop financial systems and models. You’ll be part of a collaborative and informal finance team that spans across the Nordics, where knowledge sharing and learning from each other is central.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to become a part of major and existing business cases that shape your and the company’s growth. GlobalConnect is a company with a real impact — we build and operate the digital infrastructure that keeps society connected.
   

  

 You don’t need to send a personal letter unless there’s something you want us to know that isn’t in your CV or LinkedIn profile. We’re just looking forward to getting to know you.

title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst\*** 
 - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
   

  

* internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


***Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.***
 Purpose
   

  

 This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
* Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
* Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
* Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
* Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
* Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
* Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


**Qualifications**
* University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
* At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
* Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
* Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
* Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
* Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
* Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

title: Erfarna och affärsorienterade konsulter inom AI & Data till Deloitte, Technology & Transformation
description:
Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 457,000+ people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission—to make an impact that matters—remains unchanged. This is evident not only in Deloitte’s work for clients, but also in our WorldClass ambition, our WorldClimate initiative and our ALL IN diversity and inclusion strategy.
   

  

 Jobbeskrivning
   

  

 Deloittes affärsområde Technology & Transformation Nordic är marknadsledande och samarbetar med beslutsfattare i globala och lokala organisationer. Vi stöttar organisationer i deras utmaningar gällande strategiska frågor och i implementeringen av komplexa transformationer som ofta inkluderar stora affärsdrivna IT-förändringar.
   

  

 Deloittes AI- och datateam växer och söker seniora ledare med passion för AI, data och strategisk rådgivning. Vi ser en stark efterfrågan på Deloitte och våra tjänsteerbjudanden och behöver mer senior kapacitet för att kunna hjälpa våra kunder, öka storleken på vår affär, och för att supportera teamet. Vi har partnerskap med marknadsledande leverantörer som gör att vi kan befinna oss i framkant av ny teknologi.
   

  

 Din roll kommer, tillsammans med andra ledare inom AI och data, att bidra till att driva Deloittes marknadserbjudanden framåt på marknaden, arbeta i kundprojekt samt leda och utveckla våra juniora kollegor.
   

  

**I denna roll får du:**
* Leda och driva högprioriterade AI-, analys- och datatransformationsinitiativ från start till mål – från strategi till implementation
* Bygga affärsrelationer och agera rådgivare för C-level och seniora intressenter för att upptäcka nya möjligheter
* Utveckla och följa upp en pipeline av affärsmöjligheter och driva relevanta offerter och anbudsförfrågningar (RFP/RFI)
* Arbeta med affärsutvecklingsorienterade aktiviteter och driva adoptionen av nästa generations- AI- och dataplattformar samt säkerställa att organisationer ligger före branschtrender
* Utveckla ett högpresterande mångsidigt team och coacha kollegor i deras utveckling
* Hjälpa till med rekrytering av nya talanger


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har Bachelor/Master inom systemvetenskap, är ingenjör eller ekonom
* Talar flytande svenska och är bosatt i Sverige
* Har en teknisk kunskap och intresse inom maskininlärning, data science och dataanalys
* Har 8-12 års erfarenhet från konsultbranschen av att leverera projekt, med en påvisbar förmåga att uppnå intäktsmål
* Har goda kommunikations- och presentationsförmågor
* Har förmåga att effektivt förmedla komplexa tekniska koncept till både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper


 Ytterligare information
   

  

**Hur du ansöker**
 Du ansöker online. Vi uppmuntrar dig att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt eftersom vi granskar ansökningar löpande och håller intervjuer kontinuerligt. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV, personligt brev och dina universitetsbetyg i din ansökan.
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del av Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll för att öka medvetenheten om våra framtida medarbetare, säkerställa arbetsmiljön för våra anställda och uppfylla regulatoriska krav. Bakgrundskontrollen genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/
   

  

**Frågor?**
 Om du har några frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta Sam Mottaghi på smottaghi@deloitte.se. För frågor gällande ansökningsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Linn Halmstand på lhalmstrand@deloitte.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**What impact will you make?**
 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnadför andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: IT Support Technician till Cary Group
description:
Är du en serviceinriktad och tekniskt kunnig person som brinner för att hjälpa användare och lösa IT-relaterade problem? Vill du vara en del av ett internationellt företag i en expansiv fas?
   

  

 Då kan rollen som IT Support Technician på Cary Group vara något för dig!
   

  

**Din vardag:**
 Som IT Support Technician Cary Group kommer du att spela en central roll i att stödja våra användare och säkerställa att IT-miljön fungerar smidigt. Du arbetar både självständigt och i samarbete med IT-avdelningen, verksamheten och externa leverantörer för att hantera tekniska utmaningar och förbättra IT-tjänster.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Ge teknisk support och hjälp till användare för att lösa problem med hårdvara, mjukvara och nätverk.
* Hantera och eskalera ärenden inom helpdesk och säkerställa snabb och effektiv återkoppling.
* Installera, konfigurera och uppdatera programvara på användares enheter enligt organisationens riktlinjer.
* Hjälpa användare med nätverksanslutning och felsökning av uppkopplingsproblem.
* Utföra säkerhetskopiering av data och hjälpa till med återställning vid behov.
* Utbilda användare i användning av IT-system och skapa lösningsguider samt uppdatera dokumentation.
* Bidra till och stödja organisationens systemförvaltning och Cloud transformation
* Vara med att utveckla arbetssätt för att kunna jobba smartare


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av IT-support och en stark vilja att hjälpa andra. Du är en problemlösare som trivs med att arbeta självständigt, men också i samarbete med andra. Du har en god teknisk förståelse och förmågan att kommunicera tekniska begrepp på ett enkelt och tydligt sätt.
   

  

 Du är serviceinriktad och lyhörd för användarnas behov, med tålamod och empati vid hantering av deras problem och frågor. Du har en flexibel inställning och kan anpassa dig till förändrade arbetsuppgifter och prioriteringar. Som person är du organiserad och noggrann i dokumentation och registrering av användarförfrågningar. Du har dessutom en genuin passion för teknik och drivs av att hjälpa andra att dra nytta av dess fördelar.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har:
   

  

* Grundläggande kunskaper inom datorhårdvara, operativsystem och vanlig programvara.
* God kännedom inom Microsoft 365 och Azure.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en helpdesk eller IT-supportroll.
* Starka felsöknings- och problemlösningsförmågor.
* Goda kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt.
* Grundläggande kunskaper om nätverk och internetprotokoll (IP) är meriterande.
* Ett starkt intresse för teknik och en vilja att utvecklas inom IT-området.


 Språkkunskaper:
   

  

* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Om Cary Group**
 Cary Group är en snabbväxande internationell koncern med en unik mix av entreprenöriell anda och trygg struktur. Vi är en av marknadsledarna i Europa inom reparation och byte av fordonsglas, bussglas samt reparation av plåt- och lackskador. Vi erbjuder tjänster som förlänger fordonens livslängd och bibehåller deras säkerhetsfunktioner, med fokus på att reparera i stället för att byta ut.
   

  

 Vi värnar om vår varma och inkluderande kultur och investerar i aktiviteter och event för att stärka vårt team. Vårt kontor är beläget i Hammarby Sjöstad i Stockholm.
   

  

 För mer information besök: www.carygroup.com
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Cary Group med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sandra Åhs på sandra.ahs@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande och även så urvalet av kandidater som går vidare till intervju.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about driving behavioral and cultural change in information security? Do you excel in communication and management reporting? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to make a real impact!
   

  

**About the Role | Non-Technical Information Security Specialist**
 As an Information Security Specialist focused on communication and awareness, you’ll play a key role in shaping Tryg’s cybersecurity culture. Working within our Nordic Group IT Security team, you’ll lead and innovate our awareness program, manage ongoing initiatives, and introduce new strategies. Furthermore, you will play a crucial role in our IT department’s Contingency team, where you will be onboarded as the communication lead.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Leading and enhancing our security awareness efforts—crafting compelling content, running campaigns, and developing role-based training in collaboration with business units.
* Managing the communication strategy for cybersecurity awareness, including phishing reporting and education across all organizational levels.
* Supporting the CISO in management reporting—driving the process, coordinating with stakeholders, ensuring high-quality deliverables, and maintaining baseline documentation.


 Since our IT-organization operates across Denmark, Norway, and Sweden, the position can be based in any of these locations.
   

  

**About you | A Communicator, Coordinator, and Culture-Changer**
 To thrive in this role, you’ll need a higher education in communication and/or IT. While prior experience in security awareness and management reporting is a plus, your enthusiasm and commitment to learning through certifications, courses, and peer training are what truly matter.
   

  

**We Imagine That You Have**
* A strong interest in information security awareness.
* Excellent communication skills with audiences at all organizational levels.
* Experience in management reporting.
* Knowledge of or experience with change management and behavioral change principles.
* A proactive approach to crisis communication and contingency planning.
* Proficiency in PowerPoint, Confluence, and Jira.
* The ability to work independently while building strong internal and external connections.


**About Us | CISO Office in Group IT Security**
 At Tryg, Group IT Security consists of three closely collaborating teams, working to drive security, risk, and governance initiatives. As part of the CISO Office, you’ll be at the heart of policy-making, risk assessment, and cyber defense—helping to safeguard our digital future.
   

  

 As an IT professional working at Tryg, every day is your chance to make an impact and help shape the future IT setup of a leading Nordic insurance company. We’re looking to take every aspect of our IT setup and solutions to the next level, so all your ideas, ambition, input and experience are welcome and valuable. From agile workflows to best practices in development and choosing which new emerging technologies to bank on, your word matters here.
   

  

**Curious?**
 Send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 8th of June as we’ll be conducting interviews continuously.
   

  

 If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Chief Information Security Officer, Frederic Høgsberg Kristensen at frederic.hoegsberg.kristensen@tryg.dk.
   

  

 Final candidates will undergo a background check.
   

  

**Union Representatives**
 Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, +46 70 168 28 44

title: Web Engineer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 Company Overview: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies. About Us: In 2018, Zettle joined forces with PayPal to go further in its mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. By offering them easy tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we are empowering merchants from all over the world to reach their full potential. Our journey in putting an end to ordinary is just starting. Together, we’re extraordinary. Together, we’re made for more and the best is yet to come. Are you in? What you need to know about the role This is an exciting opportunity to work on interesting problems together with talented peers in a cross-functional agile team. You will create modern digital products that affect people’s lives for the better within PayPal globally. Meet our team: We are the customer team on a mission to help merchants provide compelling reasons for their customers to return, serving millions of users. We work as an Agile, cross-functional team, delivering small, high-quality increments regularly to our customers. We warmly welcome new team members and are here to support your learning journey in the way that works best for you. Location: Stockholm, Sweden. Duration: 6 months, starting July 2025
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Your way to Impact**
 In this role you will get the opportunity to work cross functionally with a skilled and high preforming team to deliver a world class experience for our users. You will tap into their years of delivery experience to turbo boost your learning so that you can help deliver exciting features and improvements to the Merchants customer experience at scale and across multiple Geolocations.
   

  

**Your day to day**
 You will focus on your learning while helping to deliver high quality solutions to our users.
   

  

 Collaborate with the team to define, design, and ship new features.
   

  

 You work closely with product to understand context and vision.
   

  

 You can bring your desire to innovate during and hack weeks and lab days on a bimonthly basis.
   

  

**What Do You Need To Bring**
 Experience with web development in react and typescript .
   

  

 You have a desire to learn and improve your skills
   

  

 You bring curiosity and energy to your work
   

  

 You bring a desire to create fantastic outcomes for users
   

  

 You are at ease sharing your knowledge, experience and opinions, but also appreciate input from your peers
   

  

* We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates and no one is equally good in all tech-stacks. Please don't hesitate to apply.


 globaluniversityinternsoftwareengineering
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
