* English speaking and writing







**Bonus Points** 




  




* Experience with frontend frameworks like
 **React** 
 ,
 **Vue** 
 , or similar.
* Exposure to Docker or containerized development.
* Swedish speaking and writing skills







**What We Offer** 




  




* 4-month contract with potential for extension.
* Hybrid work environment with flexible hours.
* Competitive compensation.
* A collaborative, fast-paced team environment.
* Opportunity to work on impactful, production-grade systems.
* Work within a very exciting business – the aviation industry.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 As a
 **Software Engineer for Installed Apps** 
 , you will bring your technical knowledge and experience into a team of software, test automation, and quality assurance engineers. You will routinely collaborate with your peers both within your own and other software teams to ensure adherence to common software development standards and practices.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Drive software development efforts in our installed applications for Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android, in close collaboration with peers and team members.
* Maintain and enhance existing solutions with a focus on quality, stability, and maintainability.
* Help modernize our suite of apps, contributing to our migration from Xamarin/Electron to a unified cross-platform solution using .NET MAUI.
* Commit to understanding and applying design patterns, software architectures, dependencies, and system interfaces.
* Take an active role in team discussions, planning, and prioritization to promote a healthy and efficient way of working.
* Ensure software meets high standards of quality, security, maintainability, and extensibility.


**What We're Looking For:**
* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of experience building and delivering installed applications across Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android platforms.
* Solid experience with .NET technologies and cross-platform development using Xamarin, MAUI, and possibly Electron.
* Working knowledge of software quality assurance principles and development best practices.
* A technical mindset with a strong attention to detail.


**Additional Skills and Requirements:**
* A structured approach to both short- and long-term development planning.
* Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills to navigate requirements from multiple disciplines.
* A respectful, professional, and values-driven mindset in line with Tobii Dynavox culture.
* Flexible, collaborative, and hands-on working style.
* Based in or around Stockholm, with the ability to meet and work from the office as needed.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
At Backlight, we help creative teams do their best work, faster. Our AI-powered products simplify complex media workflows, enabling global brands like Marvel, Vice, Google, Uber, and Universal to create high-impact content at scale. From video production to media delivery, our tools are purpose-built for the most demanding operations in the industry.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a Senior Frontend Developer to join our Stockholm team. This is a great opportunity for someone who’s passionate about building sleek, powerful interfaces—and who’s ready to take technical ownership in a collaborative, product-driven environment.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




  





 As a Senior Frontend Developer, you’ll play a key role in developing scalable, high-performance interfaces across Backlight’s products. You’ll work with a modern React stack and contribute to everything from architectural decisions and feature planning to code reviews and mentorship to junior developers. Furthermore you’ll work closely with backend developers, designers, and product managers to deliver intuitive, user-friendly experiences.
 



  




* Build and maintain elegant, fast, and accessible frontend applications using
 **React** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 , and related technologies
* Drive technical decisions around frontend architecture, tooling, and best practices
* Lead code reviews and uphold high standards in code quality, testing, and performance
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues in production environments



  





**What we’re looking for** 




  




* Strong experience with
 **React** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 , and modern
 **JavaScript (ES6+)**
* Solid understanding of state management (e.g.,
 **Redux** 
 ,
 **Zustand** 
 )
* Skilled in
 **CSS** 
 and building clean, reusable components
* Comfortable with
 **Git/GitHub** 
 and collaborative development workflows
* Background in
 **SaaS product development** 
 and a proactive mindset
* Experience/Interest in mobile development, preferably within
 **React Native**



  





 This is a full-time hybrid role based in Stockholm. We offer a collaborative, product-led environment where you can grow, make an impact, and help shape the future of media technology.
 



  





**Sound like a fit?** 




  





 Apply now and let’s build what’s next in media tech- together.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job Description** 




  





**You and your skills** 




 The ideal candidate will possess not only extensive experience with the data engineering technologies we use, but also a high level of proficiency in soft skills.
 



**Technical Responsibilities:** 




 • Implement tooling, develop data pipelines, and deliver data governance solutions.
 



 • Build and maintain streaming solutions using Kafka—previous experience with Kafka is essential.
 



 • Work extensively with Snowflake to expose data for analytical purposes, including handling access controls and ensuring data protection.
 



 • Operate within our core tech stack, which includes
 **Azure, Azure Data Factory (ADF),** 
**Kafka, Apache Airflow, SQL** 
 , Python, Snowflake, and DBT. Hands-on experience with these technologies is required.
 



 • Collaborate on system integrations, including connecting various internal and external data sources and APIs, ensuring end-to-end data flow and quality.
 



 • Be open and adaptable to handling vague or evolving technical requirements, and provide solutions in ambiguous scenarios.
 



 Additional Technical Skills (Preferred but Not Required):
 



 • Knowledge of backend languages such as .NET or Java is a plus, particularly in the context of integrating with enterprise systems or building custom connectors.
 



**Soft Skills & Collaboration:** 




 • Be a collaborative team player who is adaptable, open to change, and enthusiastic about learning.
 



 • Demonstrate strong communication and stakeholder management skills, working closely with both product teams and data consumers.
 



 • Understand stakeholder needs and translate them into effective data solutions.
 



 • Collaborate actively with the Commercial Data Hub and data-producing teams to ensure data is accessible, reliable, and usable across the organization.

title: Tech Lead - Onboarding
description:
**At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be.**
 Earlier Qliro focused on a few big customers, today we have pivoted and now we are going for the entire e-com market, starting in the Nordics but aiming to be a European leader. To succeed we must automate the system configurations. We also need to build the new best-in-class tooling where merchants can onboard themselves.
   

  

 Your new team owns the automation and self-configuration tools. This is a greenfield project based upon AWS step-functions, .NET and React. We fully own our domain, where to go and how to get there.
   

  

**Your focus will be to:**
 You will lead the design of technical solutions aligned with our overarching strategies and guide your team's development activities by assisting in breaking down tasks and estimate efforts needed to reach your goals. You will divide your time between leading the team as well as doing hands on coding.
   

  

 You will ensure that the team's solutions adhere to Qliro’s guidelines and meet regulatory and security standards and implement tactics to improve and maintain code quality.
   

  

 Communicate the product team’s target architecture and vision to the team as well as supporting the Product Manager with your team's technical perspectives in their discovery, planning and stakeholder management.
   

  

 You will mentor less experienced team members by providing constructive feedback as well as collaborate with our Engineering Manager to further develop the team's competence.
   

  

 As a tech lead at Qliro, you are also a part of out extended leadership team where you will discuss strategies with leaders across Qliro in order to further redefine what Qliro and Payments can be.
   

  

**What we are looking for in our new tech lead:**
 👩‍💻You are highly experienced in AWS, .NET and React.js and have touched the majority of tools in the rest of the stack
   

  

 🦸🏽‍♀️ Leadership skills to inspire and guide the team in the transition to a modern architecture prepared for Qliro’s current and future business needs
   

  

 🚀 You have practical experience from working with agile engineering methods combined with a solid understanding of software engineering best practices
   

  

 🤖 You have an understanding of system design, data structures and API development
   

  

**If this sounds like you, we would really like to get in touch - please apply below!**
***Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual* 
 orientation
 *or age.***

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Mortgage Product
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 Now we need you, your ambition, and your expertise to join us as we continue to grow our product offering within Mortgage. You will be joining a small entrepreneurial team working closely within the dynamics of the larger organisation to provide a top-class mortgage comparison service to our customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a skilled and well-rounded senior developer who enjoys being engaged in the product development process and actively participating in discovery and prioritization, with an ability to balance delivery speed versus technical necessities. Your focus will be on designing, developing, and maintaining mission-critical backend services, while also contributing to the frontend to ensure seamless customer experiences.
   

  

 You will be working closely with your product manager, designers, and fellow developers to take full ownership of the product lifecycle. We expect you not to shy away from interacting with the full team and asking extensive questions as part of the continuous delivery process.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in an empowered product team to shape technical solutions that solve real customer problems.
* Participate in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
* Design, build, and maintain scalable and secure backend services, including APIs, data models, and infrastructure, that drive customer-facing applications with a focus on performance, reliability, and maintainability.
* Analyse usage data and system performance to inform architectural and product decisions.
* Contribute to frontend development when needed, ensuring a cohesive experience across the stack.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.


**Qualifications**
* Proven track record as a developer with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, preferably with full-stack responsibility and high shipping frequency.
* Relevant Computer Science or Engineering Education (at least at BA level) or equivalent experience from work.
* Solid understanding of software development principles and methodologies.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Bonus if you have experience working with data science, analytics, or machine learning workflows—whether through building data pipelines, supporting experimentation, or integrating predictive models into production systems.


 We value experience or familiarity with our chosen technologies, such as Node.js, React, Docker, AWS, but for the right candidate who has shown curiosity in different technologies and architectures, we will provide the necessary learning environment to quickly get up to speed with our stack and ways of working.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Erfarna systemingenjörer till Naval Combat Systems
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Drivs du av att bidra till en säkrare värld? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva verksamhet.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vi söker nu erfarna ingenjörer som vill jobba med oss på affärsenheten Naval Combat Systems! Här får du chansen att vara en del av systemarbetet för att vidareutveckla världens främsta ledningssystem. Våra produkter används på marina plattformar, såsom ytfartyg och ubåtar, och har till uppgift att sammanställa information från sensorer, datalänkar och vapensystem i syfte att ge operatören bästa möjlighet att fatta rätt beslut i rätt tid. Läs mer om våra produkter här.
   

  

 Som systemingenjör hos oss har du en central roll och ansvar i framtagning av krav på produkten, utifrån analys av krav och behov hos kunderna. Kraven används av våra utvecklingsavdelningar för att implementera i hård- och/eller mjukvara. Just nu har vi ett stort behov av duktiga, erfarna medarbetare som är intresserade av t ex kunna bryta ned kundkrav till realiserbara krav och design/arkitektur. Behovet av tekniska ledare är också stort så har du ambitioner för det finns även möjligheter till sådan utveckling.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du att jobba med intressant teknik i avancerade och komplexa system. Många lösningar hittar vi tillsammans med andra inom projektet och organisationen som har kompletterande kompetenser.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 Vi välkomnar dig till något av våra projekt med möjlighet att jobba och samtidigt lära dig av oss om våra produkter. Våra introduktionsprogram ger en snabb väg in i jobbet och en god förståelse för våra produkter, arbetssätt och om Saab. Introduktionsprogrammet erbjuder dig även ditt första nätverk av kollegor från våra olika ingenjörsområden.
   

  

 Vi har dessutom egna områdesspecifika utbildningar att erbjuda dig som systemingenjör, anpassade efter din erfarenhet inom området. Bra och engagerade arbetskamrater och en god stämning på jobbet vågar vi också lova. Den här rollen ger en genuin systemförståelse och bra grund för fortsatt karriär och vidareutveckling inom vår affärsenhet eller andra delar av Saab.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en proaktiv inställning i jobbet, är bra på att hitta effektiva lösningar och öppen för att prova nytt. Med engagemang och kreativitet tar du dig an uppgifter. Du har god kommunikationsförmåga, navigerar aktivt i organisationen och är skicklig på att samarbeta med våra interna och externa intressenter för att förebygga och lösa uppkomna utmaningar och problem. Eftersom vårt arbete är teambaserat, tror vi att du både trivs med att samarbeta med andra och har förmågan att jobba självständigt. Hos oss värderar vi långsiktighet och balans i yrkeslivet – något vi hoppas att även du prioriterar.
   

  

**Erfarenheter och färdigheter vi söker:**
* Erfarenhet av kravarbete och mjukvaruutveckling i komplexa system
* Kompetens inom systemdesign och/eller tekniskt ledarskap
* Praktisk erfarenhet av verifiering och test på systemnivå
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift


**Meriterande erfarenheter:**
* Högre teknisk utbildning (civilingenjör eller motsvarande)
* Kompetens inom programmering, datorarkitektur/operativsystem eller IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet från en marin miljö eller arbete inom försvarssektorn


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Security Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Security Infrastructure Engineer to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Secure Infrastructure domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Security Infrastructure Engineer who wants to create advanced security solutions in our Secure Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**Secure Infrastructure**
 Looking at the actual threat landscape today, it’s more important than ever to design and build infrastructure solutions that incorporate correct and relevant security features. The team works closely together using their combined knowledge and experience gathered from different projects and Incident Response cases to help our customers stay ahead of the threat actors. We continuously help customers improve their security posture within cloud, data center, endpoint management, identity, M365, and networking.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Security engineer interfaces regularly with team members and customers, determine technical requirements, feasibility of projects and expectations. You are responsible for maintaining, implementing, and designing client-facing solutions primarily in Active Directory, Entra ID, Azure and Microsoft 365 Security Solutions. This role is for someone who wants to be hands-on in a Microsoft infrastructure role leaning towards cloud but with the experience and knowledge of On-premises/hybrid environments. You must be able to think on your feet and you’ve got to want to learn and be part of a highly skilled and innovative team.
   

  

 Other responsibilities you might have can be:
   

  

* Run health and security checks on Active Directory, Microsoft 365 including Entra ID.
* Assisting our Customers with Tiering Projects.
* Provide customers with design and also assist with the actual implementation.
* Implement solutions based on Statement of Work with customers.


**Your Potential Background**
 We believe that your background probably entails 7+ years of experience and expertise within Microsoft solutions for both Cloud and On-premise/hybrid environments. You feel comfortable with guiding stakeholders towards a more secure and robust environment by giving technical recommendations that can persist the current threats present today.
   

  

 You are comfortable with guiding customers within areas such as: AD-Security, Entra ID-security, Windows Server Hardening, Azure security.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Active Directory Security
* Windows server Security
* Azure Security
* Microsoft 365 Security
* Overall a strong Cybersecurity competence within Microsoft Infrastructure.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell and/or Python
* Cloud migration journeys from On-prem to Azure.
* Experience with Azure networking: Express Route, Virtual Network & Load Balancers
* Hypervisor knowledge of Hyper-V, VMware.
* Experience working with monitoring and logging tools (e.g.: Log Analytics, Azure Monitor, Azure Sentinel, ELK/ElasticSearch/Kibana)
* Experience with other cloud providers such as AWS and GCP.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!
